intro: Nicandra parvimaculata, commonly known as the little-spotted nicandra, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several small, round seeds. Nicandra parvimaculata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
